body: @tannerlinsley how do we calculate bar width for this scale?
Good question. I'll do the bar example really quick

I tried merged pull request #1465, with **combo-time-scale.html** sample.
I see problem with X-axis not being updated on **Add Data** (only shifted).
Also new warning appears in console log: **Add resize listener not found**

But, the problem i am having right now is, that labels are not being used.
With labels array of **62 dates** (from **2015-07-19** to **2015-09-18**), 
the Chart is producing following result:
![screenshot_2015-09-19_10-46-30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7294788/9975417/0beb61be-5ebc-11e5-9a17-06c25dcb8925.png)

See the X-axis using the date from today till tomorrow.
The console log error is from #1467 . Do an `nom install` to get the new dependency. I'm looking into the label stuff

Damn guys, you are awesome! Instant responsiveness, even through the weekend :+1: 
Btw, the error is resolved with updated dependencies.

Also i found, that animation is not working.
Perhaps i am doing something wrong?
I build Chart.js with gulp (first i did **npm install**), and then copy the file **Chart.js** to my app. 
Are there any dependencies, that should also be copied? I assume not.

Well, perhaps there is just problem with animation being broken.
@bedenko there are no dependencies to copy. Is the animation broken during resize? #1470 should fix that issue (and eliminates the need for an external library).

Perfect!
`responsiveAnimationDuration` did the job.

I also tried to disable responsive setting, which enabled animation, but it also resized whole thing.
If you need, i can do a jsbin sample, but tell me, how to include Chart.js from rawgithub (since it should be built with gulp).
To include it in a jsbin you probably need to build it and then include the entire file as a dependency.

I just copied whole thing in:
https://jsfiddle.net/re0p99nh/
and the config is in the bottom of Javascript vindow.

It looks, that issue #1147 still exists.
I was also looking on how to fix bar width, so it would not overlap on small devices.
The animation is fixed, but the main problem with X-axis not being visible remains.

issue.title: Time scale now draws all ticks, instead of half of them

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

body:
I have updated jsfiddle with latest build and i see, that bar width is responsive now (thanks!) and that X-axis does work with time scale.
~~But there is strange behavior, and it could be jsfiddle problem, but if i open the sample in full screen, the bar width and X-axis breaks:~~
EDIT: Scratch that. Link fixed, and it is working! 
https://jsfiddle.net/re0p99nh/1/embedded/result/

One problem only...the data gets shifted to the left, so first bar gets drawn on Y-axis.

Awesome!  Not sure why that data is sitting to the left.  When you resize to smaller views, it displays correctly. I'll have to investigate that a bit more.  Closing for now! Thanks for the help @bedenko!

This is still a problem in 2.0.0 beta 2

When using a bar chart with a timescale axis, the bars are shown between ticks, but the last bar is cut off on the right hand side of the chart.
![bar_time](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8688602/12698920/509d18bc-c7a2-11e5-9503-2b9fc2c1868f.png)

When adding a line chart to the bar chart, the bars are now centred on the ticks (with the line chart's points also centred on the ticks), which means the bars extend outside the left and right of the chart area.
![bar_line_time](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8688602/12698919/509b67d8-c7a2-11e5-8ac7-a715fbcaf826.png)

Ideally, we'd want one of the following:
- dates to be shown between ticks, with the line points and bars centred between ticks (instead of on the ticks) - all sitting inside the chart area on the edges
- dates to be shown on the ticks, with the line points and bars centred on the ticks BUT extra space added on the left and right edges so the bars aren't cut off.
@claudeschneider - Currently having this issue above. Did you get this resolved?

Experiencing related issue. Bars overlapping on the left y axis. I think for now I'll simply avoid using the time x-axis.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3178348/22753119/f5cb526c-ee08-11e6-8b79-9f5c00c1c089.png)


https://jsfiddle.net/x4cL9aga/

The first and the last bar is still being cut off when using a Chart.js 2.7.2 combo bar-line chart with a time x-axis. Any fix for this bug?
![issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12759785/40113126-a36b2d3c-5908-11e8-8a5f-825f9a01e01a.PNG)
